Title.evidence: Most studies were single-centre observational cohorts from high-income countries, with no randomised trials identified.

Trial_Design.evidence: Most studies were single-centre observational cohorts from high-income countries, with no randomised trials identified.

Participants.evidence: for studies evaluating preoperative GLP-1 RA use in adults undergoing elective surgery

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to assess the safety and efficacy of preoperative GLP-1 therapy in elective surgical systems.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was perioperative safety, defined as any complication within 90 days after surgery.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Most studies were single-centre observational cohorts from high-income countries, with no randomised trials identified.

Blinding.evidence: Most studies were single-centre observational cohorts from high-income countries, with no randomised trials identified.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 21 studies, comprising 97,059 patients, met inclusion criteria; 31.9% (n = 30,981) received preoperative GLP-1 RA therapy.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Postoperative complications were reported in 12 studies, with no evidence of increased risk in GLP-1 users (pooled odds ratio: 0.78, 95% confidence interval: 0.59–1.05).

Harms.evidence: Postoperative complications were reported in 12 studies, with no evidence of increased risk in GLP-1 users

Trial_Registration.evidence: This study is registered with PROSPERO, CRD420251027809.

Funding.evidence: Funding: 10.13039/501100000272 NIHR Doctoral Research Fellowship and 10.13039/100014461 NIHR Exeter Biomedical Research Centre Senior Investigator Fellowship.
